Just noticed that the second time I imported the org.eclipse.update.ui.win32 
had a red X on the plugin.  Imported a third time and was able to launch the 
runtime.

The problem is indirectly caused by you having errors in plug-in/fragment 
manifest files (in the workspace). If your projects do not have PDE nature, you 
will not get the benefit of the PDE builder (which would parse the file and 
flag the error using the usual error markers in the editor and in the task 
list). PDE depends on the plug-in models, and when there are errors, it cannot 
get to the plug-in ID, version and other manifest information used for various 
computation.

Fixed by notifying the user during launch that some plug-ins are broken and 
also by hardening plug-in path creation.
